title: Senate Approves Trump’s Bid to Cancel Foreign Aid and Funds for NPR and PBS Stations
summary: The bill to claw back $9 billion in congressionally approved spending passed over the objections of Republicans who said it abdicated the legislative branch’s power of the purse.

summary: Plus, paying people to quit meth.

title: Even After Bondi Gains Trump’s Backing, Her Survival Remains an Open Question
summary: The sustained backlash has exposed the hazards of the attorney general’s focus on courting President Trump, with the assumption that he maintains the total backing of his base.

title: Maurene Comey, Prosecutor of Jeffrey Epstein, Is Fired
summary: Maurene Comey, who is the daughter of the former F.B.I. director James Comey, worked on the criminal cases against Jeffrey Epstein and his associate Ghislaine Maxwell.

title: Trump Wants Lower Rates. Firing Powell Could Push Them Higher.
summary: Investors, not the Fed, control the interest rates that matter most to businesses and consumers. They might demand higher returns if the central bank’s independence comes into question.

title: Can Trump Fire Powell? He Likely Lacks Case to Remove Fed Chair, Experts Say.
summary: The Trump administration is toying with removing Jerome H. Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve, accusing him of mismanaging a multibillion-dollar update to its Washington headquarters.

title: How Two Cabins Turned Into an Epicenter of Grief
summary: The children who lost their lives at Camp Mystic were not scattered through the camp. Almost every one of them was in either the Bubble Inn or Twins cabins, which housed the youngest campers.

title: Why Israel Attacked Syria
summary: For weeks, Israel has engaged in back-channel talks over a diplomatic agreement with the Syrian government. Its strikes on Damascus this week highlight a lack of strategic clarity.

title: Syria’s President Condemns Israeli Strikes on Damascus
summary: President Ahmed al-Shara said the attack threatened to escalate sectarian violence in his sharpest criticism of Israel since coming to power.

title: Connie Francis, Whose Ballads Dominated ’60s Pop Music, Dies at 87
summary: Ms. Francis, who had a natural way with a wide variety of material, ruled the charts with songs like “Who’s Sorry Now” and “Don’t Break the Heart that Loves You.”

title: As ‘Pretty Little Baby’ Goes Viral, Connie Francis Is Joining TikTok
summary: A forgotten song became an unlikely hit, and the 87-year-old singer was happy to be back in the spotlight.

summary: With help from a longtime Silicon Valley investor turned White House insider, Mr. Huang got the administration to reverse course on restrictions.

title: Wall St. Firms Are Buying Utilities to Tap Into the A.I. Boom

title: Faith Leaders Can Now Endorse. Will That Swing the NYC Mayor’s Race?

title: Adams Eclipses Mamdani in Recent Fund-Raising, as Cuomo Lags Behind
summary: Mayor Eric Adams reported raising $1.5 million over the last month, but his inability to qualify for matching funds may hamper his re-election bid.

title: N.Y.C. Panel Withdraws Proposal to Switch to Open Primaries
summary: The panel, created by Mayor Eric Adams, said it would introduce other ballot initiatives, but not a proposal that would allow all voters to participate in primaries regardless of party.

title: Trump’s Brazil Tariff Threats Rekindle Support for President Lula
summary: Once called the planet’s most popular politician, President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva of Brazil faced long odds in next year’s election. President Trump’s tariffs are changing that.

summary: American consumers of Korean cosmetics and skin-care products are bulk buying, as President Trump threatens 25 percent tariffs on imports.

summary: President Trump has threatened to increase Mexico’s tariff rate to 30 percent starting Aug. 1, claiming the country hasn’t sufficiently tackled drug cartels.

summary: Local officials blamed shoddy construction and a lack of preparedness for the scale of the tragedy at the newly opened building.

title: Germany’s Merz and UK’s Starmer Meet to Cement Ties as U.S. Steps Back
summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s trip to London on Thursday is the latest sign of a new world order, in which European nations are uniting amid growing instability.

title: ‘Who Killed Love?’ A Video Game Plays to Male Resentment in China.

summary: Shinjiro Koizumi has scrambled to cut soaring rice prices ahead of a high-stakes election this weekend. Will it be enough to buoy support for the Liberal Democratic Party?

title: Trump’s National Guard Troops Are Questioning Their Mission in L.A.
